Description: Simplifying Radical Expressions1

Title: Simplifying square roots
Description: Roots are nice, but we prefer dealing with regular numbers as much as possible. So, for example, instead of √4 we prefer dealing with 2. What about roots that aren't equal to an integer, like √20? Still, we can write 20 as 4⋅5 and then use known properties to write √(4⋅5) as √4⋅√5, which is 2√5. We *simplified* ...Show More

Title: Simplifying square roots (Hindi)
Description: Roots are nice, but we prefer dealing with regular numbers as much as possible. So, for example, instead of √4 we prefer dealing with 2. What about roots that aren't equal to an integer, like √20? Still, we can write 20 as 4⋅5 and then use known properties to write √(4⋅5) as √4⋅√5, which is 2√5. We *simplified* ...Show More

Title: Simplifying polynomials
Description: Simplifying the polynomial 3x²-8x+7+2x³-x²+8x-3 by combining like terms.

Title: Linear equations word problems: earnings
Description: Sal finds the slope of a linear relationship between the number of work hours and the money earned. He then interprets what this slope means in that context.

Title: Slope from equation
Description: Worked examples of finding the slope of a line given its equation, using many forms of equations.

Title: Intro to slope-intercept form
Description: Slope-intercept form, y=mx+b, of linear equations, emphasizes the slope and the y-intercept of the line. Watch this video to learn more about it and see some examples.

Title: Slope-intercept form from a table
Description: Learn how to write an equation of the line that matches up to a table of values.

Title: Worked examples: slope-intercept intro
Description: Worked examples practicing the relationship between slope, y-intercept, and linear equation in slope-intercept form.

Title: Slope & direction of a line
Description: Sal graphs a line that has a slope that is negative and greater than the slope of another line.

Title: Worked example: slope from graph
Description: The slope of a line is rise over run. Learn how to calculate the slope of the line in a graph by finding the change in y and the change in x.

Title: Worked example: slope from two points
Description: Find the slope of the line that goes through the ordered pairs (4,2) and (-3, 16).

Title: Slope of a horizontal line
Description: When two points have the same y-value, it means they lie on a horizontal line. The slope of such a line is 0, and you will also find this by using the slope formula.

Title: Line of best fit: smoking in 1945
Description: Sal estimates the percentage of American adults who smoked in 1945 using a scatter plot.

Title: Thiago asks: How much time does a goalkeeper have to react to a penalty kick?
Description: Sal uses the Pythagorean theorem to answer a question posed by a soccer superstar!

Title: Volume of triangular prism & cube
Description: Using the formulas for the volume of triangular prism and cube to solve some solid geometry problems.

Title: Solving and graphing linear inequalities
Description: N/A

Title: Solved example: compound interest
Description: In a previous video, we learned that compound interest is just a special case of percentage increase. Here, let's learn how to solve problems involving compound interest by solving an example question.

Title: Worked example: two-step equations
Description: Sal solves the equation -16 = x/4 + 2. It takes two steps because he first has to subtract 2 from both sides and then multiply both sides by 4.

Title: Equations with variables on both sides: 20-7x=6x-6
Description: Sal solves the equation 20 - 7x = 6x - 6.

Title: Equations with parentheses
Description: Sal solves the equation -9 - (9x - 6) = 3(4x + 6) using the distributive property.

Title: Equation with variables on both sides: fractions
Description: Sal solves the equation (3/4)x + 2 = (3/8)x - 4.

Title: Solving an equation for a variable
Description: Sal solves the equation P=2I+2w for the variable I.

Title: Manipulating formulas: temperature
Description: Sal takes the formula for converting from Fahrenheit temperature to Celsius, and solves it for F so it serves to convert from Celsius to Fahrenheit.

Title: Factoring perfect squares: missing values
Description: Sal analyzes the factorization of x^2+5x+c as (x+d)^2 to find the values of the missing coefficients c and d.

Title: Systems of equations with graphing
Description: Sal shows how to solve a system of linear equations by graphing and looking for the point of intersection.

Title: One-step subtraction equations
Description: Learn how to solve this equation: a + 5 = 54

Title: One-step multiplication equations
Description: Remember that what you do to one side, you have to do to the other. Will you multiply or divide both sides to dump the fraction, x/a? Let's do it together.

Title: Solving percent problems
Description: We'll use algebra to solve this percent problem.

Title: Percent word problem: 100 is what percent of 80?
Description: This word problem is expressed simply which can be confusing to some. Take your time and focus on the what is being asked for.

Title: Percent word problem: 78 is 15% of what number?
Description: In this example, you working with us to find the number that is expressed as a given percentage. We'll create a simple algebraic equation to solve!

Title: Systems of equations with elimination: TV & DVD
Description: Sal solves a word problem about the weights of TVs and DVDs by creating a system of equations and solving it.

Title: Systems of equations with elimination: 3t+4g=6 & -6t+g=6
Description: Sal solves the system of equations 3t + 4g = 6 and -6t + g = 6 using elimination.

Title: Systems of equations with elimination: 4x-2y=5 & 2x-y=2.5
Description: Sal solves the system of equations 4x - 2y = 5 and 2x - y = 2.5 using elimination.

Title: Number of solutions to a system of equations
Description: Sal is given three lines on the coordinate plane, and identifies one system of two lines that has a single solution, and one system that has no solution.

Title: Systems of equations number of solutions: y=3x+1 & 2y+4=6x
Description: Sal graphs a system of equations to find the number of solutions it has.

Title: Systems of equations with substitution: y=-1/4x+100 & y=-1/4x+120
Description: Learn to solve the system of equations y = -1/4x + 100 and y = -1/4x + 120 using substitution.

Title: Systems of equations with substitution: y=4x-17.5 & y+2x=6.5
Description: Learn to solve the system of equations y = 4x - 17.5 and y + 2x = 6.5 using substitution.

Title: Systems of equations with substitution: 9x+3y=15 & y-x=5
Description: Learn to solve the system of equations 9x + 3y = 15 and y - x = 5 using substitution.

Title: Systems of equations with graphing: y=7/5x-5 & y=3/5x-1
Description: Sal graphs the following system of equations and solves it by looking for the intersection point: y=7/5x-5 and y=3/5x-1.

Title: Systems of equations with graphing: exact & approximate solutions
Description: Sal solves a system of two linear equations in standard form, and then approximates the solution of a system whose solution isn't clearly visible.

Title: Systems of equations with substitution: potato chips
Description: To solve a system of equations using substitution... 1. Isolate one of the variables in one of the equations, e.g. rewrite 2x+y=3 as y=3-2x. 2. You can now express the isolated variable using the other one. *Substitute* that expression into the second equation, e.g. rewrite x+2y=5 as x+2(3-2x)=5. 3. ...Show More

Title: Systems of equations: trolls, tolls (2 of 2)
Description: Solving the system of equations visually. Now we can save the prince/princess.

Title: Comparing irrational numbers with radicals
Description: Learn how to sort a bunch of numbers (4√2 2√3 3√2 √17 3√3 5) from least to greatest without using a calculator.

Title: Special products of the form (ax+b)(ax-b)
Description: Sal expands the difference of squares (2x+8)(2x-8) as 4x²-64.

Title: More examples of special products
Description: Sal gives numerous examples of the two special binomial product forms: perfect squares and the difference of two squares.

Title: Special products of binomials: two variables (Hindi)
Description: Anmol finds the area of a square with side (6x-5y).

Title: Squaring a binomial (old)
Description: An old video where Sal expands and simplifies (7x+10)².

Title: Special products of binomials: two variables
Description: Sal finds the area of a square with side (6x-5y).

Title: Special products of the form (ax+b)(ax-b) (Hindi)
Description: Anmol expand the difference of squares (2x+8)(2x-8) as 4x²-64.

Title: Special products of the form (x+a)(x-a) (Hindi)
Description: Anmol introduces difference of squares expressions. For example, (x+3)(x-3) is expanded as x²-9.

Title: Squaring binomials of the form (ax+b)²
Description: Sal expands the perfect square (7x+10)² as 49x^2+140x+100.

Title: Square roots by division method visualised
Description: Let's understand why the square root by division method (digit by digit method) works.

Title: Squaring a binomial old (Hindi)
Description: A video where Anmol expands and simplifies (7x+10)².

Title: Squaring binomials of the form (ax+b)² (Hindi)
Description: Anmol expands the perfect square (7x+10)² as 49x^2+140x+100.

Title: Squaring binomials of the form (x+a)² (Hindi)
Description: Anmol introduces perfect square expressions. For example, (x+7)² is expanded as x²+14x+49.

Title: Statistics intro: Mean, median, & mode
Description: The mean (average) of a data set is found by adding all numbers in the data set and then dividing by the number of values in the set. The median is the middle value when a data set is ordered from least to greatest. The mode is the number that occurs most often in a data set.

Title: Describing steps when solving equations
Description: Sal lists the steps necessary in order to solve a linear equation. This is useful for thinking more strategically about equations.

Title: Strategy in factoring quadratics (part 1 of 2)
Description: There are a lot of methods to factor quadratics, which apply on different occasions and conditions. After learning all of them in separate, let's think strategically about which method is useful for a given quadratic expression we want to factor.

Title: Strategy in factoring quadratics (part 2 of 2)
Description: There are a lot of methods to factor quadratics, which apply on different occasions and conditions. After learning all of them in separate, let's think strategically about which method is useful for a given quadratic expression we want to factor.

Title: Strategy in factoring quadratics (part 1 of 2) (Hindi)
Description: There are a lot of methods to factor quadratics, which apply on different occasions and conditions. After learning all of them in separate, let's think strategically about which method is useful for a given quadratic expression we want to factor.

Title: Strategy in factoring quadratics (part 2 of 2) (Hindi)
Description: There are a lot of methods to factor quadratics, which apply on different occasions and conditions. After learning all of them in separate, let's think strategically about which method is useful for a given quadratic expression we want to factor.

Title: Subset, strict subset, and superset
Description: Sal explains the difference between a subset, a strict subset, and a superset. He also explains the notation behind these ideas.

Title: Systems of equations with substitution: y=-5x+8 & 10x+2y=-2
Description: Learn to solve the system of equations y = -5x + 8 and 10x + 2y = -2 using substitution.

Title: Systems of equations with substitution: coins
Description: Sal solves a word problem about the number of nickels and quarters in a piggy bank by creating a system of equations and solving it.

Title: Subtracting in scientific notation
Description: Learn how to subtract numbers written in scientific notation. The problem solved in this video is (4.1 * 10^-2) - (2.6 * 10^-3).

Description: Anmol simplifies (16x+14) - (3x² + x - 9).

Description: Anmol simplifies (4x²y - 3xy + 25) - (9y²x + 9yx² + 7xy - 20).

Title: Subtracting polynomials
Description: Sal simplifies (16x+14) - (3x² + x - 9).

Title: Subtracting polynomials: two variables
Description: Sal simplifies (4x²y - 3xy + 25) - (9y²x + 7xy - 20).

Title: Sums of consecutive integers
Description: Sal solves the following age word problem: The sum of 4 consecutive odd integers is 136. What are the 4 integers?

Title: Sum of integers challenge
Description: Sal solves the following problem: The sum of three consecutive odd integers is 231. What is the largest integer?

Title: Sum of integers challenge (Hindi)
Description: Anmol solves the following problem: The sum of three consecutive odd integers is 231. What is the largest integer?

Title: Sum of interior angles of a polygon
Description: Learn how to find the sum of the interior angles of any polygon.

Title: Sum of interior angles of a polygon (Hindi)
Description: Learn how to find the sum of the interior angles of any polygon.

Title: Sum of the exterior angles of a polygon (Hindi)
Description: Sal demonstrates how the the sum of the exterior angles of a convex polygon is 360 degrees.

Title: Sum of the exterior angles of a polygon
Description: Sal demonstrates how the the sum of the exterior angles of a convex polygon is 360 degrees.

Title: Sums of consecutive integers (Hindi)
Description: Anmol solves the following age word problem: The sum of 4 consecutive odd integers is 136. What are the 4 integers?

Title: Surface area of a box (cuboid)
Description: Surface area is the sum of the areas of all faces (or surfaces) on a 3D shape. A cuboid has 6 rectangular faces. To find the surface area of a cuboid, add the areas of all 6 faces. We can also label the length (l), width (w), and height (h) of the prism and use the formula, SA=2lw+2lh+2hw, to find the ...Show More

Title: Surface area of a box (cuboid) (Hindi)
Description: Surface area is the sum of the areas of all faces (or surfaces) on a 3D shape. A cuboid has 6 rectangular faces. To find the surface area of a cuboid, add the areas of all 6 faces. We can also label the length (l), width (w), and height (h) of the prism and use the formula, SA=2lw+2lh+2hw, to find the ...Show More

Title: Surface area of a box using nets
Description: Learn how to find the surface area of cereal box using nets.

Title: Surface area of a box using nets (Hindi)
Description: Learn how to find the surface area of cereal box using nets.

Title: Surface area using a net: rectangular prism (Hindi)
Description: A polyhedron is a three-dimensional shape that has flat surfaces and straight edges. Learn whether or not a certain net could be folded up into a certain rectangular prism.

Title: Surface area word problem example
Description: Sal solves a word problem that involves surface area of a square pyramid.

Title: System of equations word problem: walk & ride
Description: Systems of equations can be used to solve many real-world problems. In this video, we solve a problem about distances walking and riding bus to school.

Title: System of equations word problem: infinite solutions
Description: Systems of equations can be used to solve many real-world problems. In this video, we solve a problem about a vegetable farmer. In this case, the problem has infinite solutions, which means there's not enough information to find a single solution.

Title: Systems of equations with elimination: 6x-6y=-24 & -5x-5y=-60
Description: Sal solves the system of equations 6x - 6y = -24 and -5x - 5y = -60 using elimination.

Title: System of equations word problem: no solution
Description: Systems of equations can be used to solve many real-world problems. In this video, we solve a problem about a toy factory. In this case, the problem has no viable solution, which means the information describes an impossible situation.

Title: Percent of a whole number
Description: There are several different ways to solve problems involving percentages, decimals, and fractions. Watch as Sal finds the percentage of a whole number.

Title: Taking percentages
Description: Taking a percentage of a number.

Title: Percent word problems: tax and discount
Description: Sal solves percent word problems involving tax, tip, and discounts.

Title: The parts of polynomial expressions
Description: Learn about the parts of polynomial expressions (including terms, coefficients, and exponents).

Title: Testing a solution to a system of equations
Description: Sal checks whether (-1,7) is a solution of the system: x+2y=13 and 3x-y=-11.

Title: Congruent shapes & transformations
Description: Sal shows that a given pair of pentagons are congruent by mapping one onto the other using rigid transformations.

Title: Testing if a relationship is a function
Description: Learn to determine if points on a graph represent a function.

Title: Similar shapes & transformations
Description: Sal is given pairs of polygons, and then he determines whether they are similar by trying to map one onto the other using angle-preserving transformations.

Title: Testing solutions to equations
Description: A solution to an equation makes that equation true. Learn how to test if a certain value of a variable makes an equation true.

Title: Testing solutions to inequalities
Description: A solution to an inequality makes that inequality true. Learn how to test if a certain value of a variable makes an inequality true.

Title: Distributive property over addition
Description: Learn how to apply the distributive law of multiplication over addition and why it works. This is sometimes just called the distributive law or the distributive property.

Title: Distributive property over subtraction
Description: Learn how to apply the distributive property of multiplication over subtraction and why it works. This is sometimes just called the distributive property or distributive law.

Title: The parts of polynomial expressions (Hindi)
Description: Learn about the parts of polynomial expressions (including terms, coefficients, and exponents).

Title: Intro to the Pythagorean theorem
Description: Sal introduces the famous and super important Pythagorean theorem!

Title: Systems of equations with substitution: 2y=x+7 & x=y-4
Description: Learn to use substitution to solve the system of equations 2y = x + 7 and x = y - 4.

Title: The why of the 3 divisibility rule
Description: Why you can add the digits to see if something is divisible by 3

Title: The why of the 9 divisibility rule
Description: Why you can test divisibility by 9 by just adding the digits

Title: The zeroth power
Description: Learn why a number raised to the zero power equals 1.

Title: Dilating shapes: expanding
Description: Sal is given a rectangle on the coordinate plane and he draws the image of the rectangle under a dilation with scale factor 1 2/3 about an arbitrary point.

Title: Sign of expressions challenge problems
Description: Some examples that test our understanding of what happens when we multply or divide a bunch of positive or negative numbers.

Title: Translating points
Description: Translations are defined by saying how much a point is moved to the left/right and up/down.

Title: Scatter plot: smokers
Description: Sal chooses the scatter plot that shows that smoking rate drops by 0.5 point each year.

Title: Triangle angle challenge problem 2 (Hindi)
Description: Example of angle hunting!

Title: Triangle angle challenge problem (Hindi)
Description: Interesting problem finding the sums of particular exterior angles of an irregular pentagon.

Title: Triangle exterior angle example
Description: Learn about the angles in a triangle and a little about exterior angles being the sum of the remote interior angles.

Title: Worked example: Triangle angles (intersecting lines)
Description: Worked examples finding angles in triangles formed by intersecting lines

Title: Worked example: Triangle angles (diagram)
Description: Worked examples finding angles in triangles that are part of diagrams

Title: Area of triangle proof
Description: Proof that shows that the area of any triangle is 1/2 b x h.

Title: Triangle exterior angle example (Hindi)
Description: Learn about the angles in a triangle and a little about exterior angles being the sum of the remote interior angles.

Title: Triangle inequality theorem (Hindi)
Description: Intuition behind the triangle inequality theorem.

Title: Triangle inequality theorem
Description: Intuition behind the triangle inequality theorem

Title: Systems of equations: trolls, tolls (1 of 2)
Description: A troll forces us to use algebra to figure out the make-up of his currency. We end up setting up a system of equations.

Title: Two-step equation word problem: computers (Hindi)
Description: Learn how to construct and solve a basic linear equation to solve a word problem.

Title: Two-step equation word problem: garden (Hindi)
Description: Here's a nifty word problem in which we find the dimensions of a garden given only the perimeter. Let's create an equation to solve!

Title: Two-step equation word problem: oranges (Hindi)
Description: Learn how to solve a word problem by writing an equation to model the situation. In this video, we use the linear equation 210(t-5) = 41,790.

Title: Two-step equations intuition (Hindi)
Description: This example demonstrates how we solve an equation expressed such: ax + b = c. It's a little more complicated than previous examples, but you can do it!

Title: Two-step equations with decimals and fractions
Description: Learn how to solve equations that involve decimals and fractions. The equations shown in this video are called "two-step" equations because they each take two steps to solve.

Title: Two-way frequency tables and Venn diagrams
Description: Sal uses a Venn diagram to introduce two-way frequency tables.

Title: Two-way relative frequency tables
Description: Worked example video where we are asked to find a two-way table of column relative frequencies.

Title: Factoring perfect squares: negative common factor
Description: Sal factors -4t^2-12t-9 as -1(2t+3)^2.

Title: Factoring difference of squares: two variables (example 2)
Description: Sal factors 49x^2-49y^2 as (7x+7y)(7x-7y) or as 49(x+y)(x-y).

Title: Exponent example 2
Description: N/A

Title: Exponent example 1
Description: Sal explains the difference between 5 × 3 and 5 to the third power

Title: Worked example: Evaluating functions from equation
Description: Learn how to evaluate f(x)=49-x² at x=5.

Title: Worked example: Evaluating functions from graph
Description: Evaluating a function at x=-1 using the graph of that function.

Title: Function notation example
Description: Sal uses function notation to help Frank figure out how much water he can put in his balloon.

Title: Understanding square roots
Description: Learn how square root means what number multiplied by itself will result in the given number.

Title: Understanding square roots (Hindi)
Description: Learn how square root means what number multiplied by itself will result in the given number.

Title: Systems of equations with elimination: coffee and croissants
Description: Sal solves a word problem about the price of coffee and croissant by creating a system of equations and solving it.

Title: How many solutions does a system of linear equations have if there are at least two?
Description: Sal answers this question for you!

Title: Universal set and absolute complement
Description: Sal moves onto more challenging set ideas and notation like the universal set and absolute complement.

Title: Systems of equations with elimination: apples and oranges
Description: Sal solves a word problem about the price of apples and oranges by creating a system of equations and solving it.

Title: Measures of angles formed by a transversal
Description: Sal solves an equation to find missing angles given two parallel lines and a transversal.

Title: Equation practice with vertical angles
Description: Given algebraic expressions that represent a pair of vertical angles, Sal forms and solves an equation.

Title: Missing value given the mean
Description: Learn how to find the value of a missing piece of data if you know the mean of the data set.

Title: Evaluating an expression with one variable
Description: Learn how to evaluate an expression with variables using a technique called substitution (or "plugging in").

Title: Variables, expressions, & equations
Description: Learn what variables, expressions, and equations are.

Title: Slicing a rectangular pyramid
Description: What happens when you slice vertically into a rectangular pyramid? What kind of geometric shape results?

Title: Volume of a cone
Description: The formula for the volume of a cone is V=1/3hπr². Learn how to use this formula to solve an example problem.

Title: Volume intro (Hindi)
Description: Anmol introduces volume and compares it to length and area. He also introduces cube units.

Title: Volume with fractional cubes
Description: Another way of finding the volume of a rectangular prism involves dividing it into fractional cubes, finding the volume of one, and then multiplying that volume by the number of cubes that fit into our rectangular prism.

Title: Volume of a rectangular prism: fractional dimensions
Description: Learn how to find the volume of a rectangular prism that has fractional side lengths. The prism in this video has dimensions 3/5 by 1 1/6 by 3/7.

Title: Volume of a sphere
Description: The formula for the volume of a sphere is V = 4/3 πr³. See the formula used in an example where we are given the diameter of the sphere.

Title: Volume word problem: gold ring
Description: See if you can find the incremental volume of a ring in cubic inches. You'll need to put to use your knowledge of how to measure volume.

Title: Volume of rectangular prism (Hindi)
Description: Anmol finds the area of a rectangular prism with labeled side lengths.

Title: Volume of triangular prism & cube (Hindi)
Description: Using the formulas for the volume of triangular prism and cube to solve some solid geometry problems.

Title: Ways to cross-section a cube
Description: Learn about all the different ways we can obtain cross-sections of a cube.

Title: Monomial factorization
Description: Sal analyzes two different factorizations of 24x^5 and determines whether they are correct.

Title: Representing data
Description: Here are a few of the many ways to look at data. Which is your favorite?

Title: What is a function?
Description: Functions assign a single output for each of their inputs. In this video, we see examples of various kinds of functions.

Title: Whether a special quadrilateral can exist
Description: Proving whether a special quadrilateral can exist or not.

Title: Whether a special quadrilateral can exist (Hindi)
Description: Proving whether a special quadrilateral can exist or not.

Title: Why SSA isn't a congruence criterion (Hindi)
Description: There are some cases when SSA can imply triangle congruence, but not always. This is why it's not like the other triangle congruence postulates/criteria.

Title: Why we do the same thing to both sides (Hindi)
Description: We will use a scale to try to achieve balance and help explain why we do the same thing to both sides of an equation, even when the variable appears on both sides.

Title: Why we do the same thing to both sides: Variable on both sides
Description: We will use a scale to try to achieve balance and help explain why we do the same thing to both sides of an equation, even when the variable appears on both sides.

Title: Same thing to both sides of equations
Description: The example of a scale where we try to achieve balance helps to explain why we do the same thing to both sides of an equation.

Title: Intro to two-step equations
Description: Here's how we solve a two step equation. It begins with the concept of equality: what we do to one side of the equation must be done to the other.

Title: Modeling with linear equations: gym membership & lemonade
Description: Constructing linear equations to solve word problems

Title: Worked eg. : evaluating exp. using structure more eg. (Hindi)
Description: A few more examples where Anmol evaluates expressions with multiple unknown variables.

Title: Close Enough? Angles & Accuracy of Measurement in Navigation
Description: Students use right triangle trigonometry and angle measurements to calculate distances using accuracy and precision. They understand the relationship between triangulation technology and other fields of study (i.e. mathematics).

Title: The Distributive Property
Description: Students learn the distributive property, which states that a(b + c) = ab + ac. In other words, the number or variable that is outside the set of parentheses "distributes" through the parentheses, multiplying by each of the numbers inside. Note that a negative sign outside a set of parentheses can be ...Show More

Title: Multiplying Polynomials

Title: Basic Math: Lesson 1 - Numbers

I also explain how to use your graphing calculator to input all types of numbers (integers, fractions, square roots, etc.).

Title: Rational Numbers
Description: The instructor explains what rational numbers are and uses a white board to model several examples using fractions, mixed numbers, and decimals. He then compares and orders rational numbers.

Title: Rational Numbers

Title: Irrational Numbers

Then, it discusses how irrational numbers relate to rational numbers. The video is good quality and good for all students as a review or initial learning of the topic.

Title: Rational Functions Lesson 2 Operations
Description: This video will teach how to add, subtract, multiply, and divide Rational Expressions in an Easy way using the Rational Numbers operations concept. Duration: 20:23

Title: Imaginary Numbers Part 1 - Introduction to Imaginary Numbers and Simplifying

Title: Do The Quad Solve (WSHS Math Rap Song)

Title: Solving a Quadratic Equation by the Quadratic Formula

Title: Quadratic Inequalities Discriminant

Title: Algebra: Formulas from Geometry

Title: Arithmetic Sequences

Title: Basic Algebra : Substituting Values Into an Algebraic Expression

Title: The Slope Formula

Title: The Order of Operations Song/Rap to Umbrella

Title: Qtr 1, Lesson 1: Writing and Evaluating Expressions and Equations
Description: An introduction to Algebra 1. We define Variables, Algebraic Expressions and Algebraic Equations, and explain how to evaluate each for any variable value.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 9: Linear Equations of Parallel and Perpendicular Lines
Description: This lesson focuses on writing equations for parallel lines and perpendicular lines. We learn to determine the equation of a line passing through some point, and parallel or perpendicular to another line.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 1: Solving Linear Inequalities
Description: Stan shows how to work with Linear Inequalities in this lesson, learning to graph and solve them (using addition and subtraction). He also includes "You Try It" exercises to test your understanding of the concepts.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 2: Graphing and Solving Compound Inequalities
Description: This lesson explains how to write, graph and solve Compound Inequalities. From MasterMath.info.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 5: Solve Linear Systems by Graphing
Description: We introduce Systems of Equations in this lesson. Using practical examples, we discover how algebra can help us make decisions.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 3: Solve Absolute Value Equations and Inequalities
Description: In this lesson, we learn to solve absolute value equations and absolute value inequalities. We also graph absolute value inequalities. (22.44)

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 4: Graph Linear Inequalities in Two Variables
Description: In this lesson we learn how to draw the boundary line and then properly shade a graph to represent a linear inequality with 2 variables.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 6: Solve Linear Systems by Adding and Subtracting and by Substitution
Description: There are three ways to solve a system of linear equations. In this lesson, we talk about two of these methods: Solving a Systems of Equations using Substitution; and Solving a System using Addition or Subtraction.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 7: Solve Systems of Linear Inequalities
Description: By graphing each member of a system of linear inequalities, we can define the solution set of points that satisfy all the inequalities.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 8: Exponential Properties Involving Products
Description: Every game has some rules. The exponential game is no exception. In this lesson we learn rules for multiplication with exponential expressions.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 10: Scientific Notation; Fractional Exponents
Description: Scientific notation is used to express very large and very small numbers. In this lesson we learn how to write and interpret numbers in scientific notation.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 11: Writing and Graphing Exponential Growth and Decay Functions
Description: This lesson explains exponential growth: does a data set represents exponential growth; how to graph that data set; and how to create an equation that describes the relationship.

Title: Qtr 1, Lesson 5: The Distributive Property
Description: This lesson discusses the Distributive Property, Equivalent Expressions, Like Terms, Coefficients, and Constant Terms.

Title: Qtr. 2, Lesson 1: Coordinate Plane, Introduction to Graphing Linear Equations
Description: This lesson reviews the coordinate plane and prepares us to start graphing equations.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 2: Functions - Domain and Range; Continuous, Discrete
Description: In order to get ready to graph functions, we need to make sure we understand a few concepts: domain, range, continuous functions and discrete functions.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 4: Slope and Rate of Change
Description: Understanding the slope of a line is critical to much of algebra. In this lesson we explain what slope means and show how to calculate it on a graph, or with coordinate points

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 5: Graphing Linear Equations in Slope-Intercept Form
Description: This lessons teaches about Slope - Intercept Form, and how to use this form to graph equations, or to determine the equation of lines.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 6: Direct Variation and Function Notation
Description: Direct Variation and Function Form are explained in this lesson.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 7: More on Slope-Intercept Form
Description: This video pushes us a little further in our understanding of Slope-Intercept Form. We work on finding equations for linear relationships when we know 2 points on the line; or one point and the slope of the line. We also find equations in slope-intercept for relationships in Function Notation.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 8: Point-Slope Form; Standard Form
Description: This video shows us how to write equations in Point-Slope Form and Standard Form. We also see how easy it is to graph an equation that is in Point-Slope Form.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 10: Fitting a Line to Data; Predictions with Linear Models
Description: This lesson discusses fitting a line to a graphed data set. We discuss positive and negative correlation, and interpolation and extrapolation.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 13 More on Polynomials: Get Ready to Factor
Description: This is the first of several lessons teaching how to factor polynomials. We learn several properties of polynomials here: the square of a binomial; the product of the sum and difference of binomials; and the zero product property.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 12 - Add, Subtract and Multiply Polynomials
Description: In this lesson, we work with Polynomials, learning about monomials, binomials, trinomials, degree, leading coefficients, and like-terms. We learn the FOIL me...

Title: Qtr. 3, Lesson 14 - Factoring Quadratics Part 1
Description: In this video, we learn to factor simple polynomials.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 15: Factoring Quadratics Part 2
Description: In this lesson we work on factoring more difficult trinomials. We discuss roots and zeros, and learn to solve quadratic equations by factoring.

Title: Qtr 3 Lesson 15: Factoring Quadratics - Addendum
Description: Here we learn a shortcut for factoring trinomials.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 16: Factoring Special Products
Description: In this lesson we work with Difference of Two Squares, Perfect Squares, Grouping, and we discuss guidelines for complete factoring of polynomials

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 2 - Graphing Quadratics Part 2
Description: We complete our study of graphing quadratics by learning what the "b" coefficient can tell us about the graph. We combine this with the information the "a"coefficient and the "c" coefficient give us, and we can graph polynomials.

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 3 - Solving Quadratic Equations by Graphing
Description: We previously solved Quadratics by factoring. In this lesson we discover that we can also solve the Quadratic by graphing it. We also learn to convert quadratics in Standard From to Intercept Form.

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 4 - Solve Quadratic Equations by Using Square Roots and by Completing the Square
Description: Here we look into several approaches to solving quadratic equations: using square roots; and completing the square.

Title: Quarete 4, Lesson 5 - The Quadratic Formula and The Discriminant
Description: This lesson describes how to solve quadratic equations using the Quadratic Formula. It also explains what the Discriminant is, and how to use it.

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 6 - Comparing Linear, Exponential and Quadratic Models
Description: The graphs of Linear, Exponential and Quadratic Equations are different from each other, and can be used to identify the type of function. In this lesson, we compare these functions, and learn to write equations for each type based on only a sampling of x and y values that satisfy the function.

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 7 - Graphing Radical Equations
Description: This lesson explains the Parent Square Root Function and its graph, and shows how variations of the Parent Function graph differently than the function.

Title: Algebra 1 - Simplifying Radical Expressions
Description: We learn the rules for simplifying radical expressions: 1) no perfect squares; 2) no fractions in radicand; 3) no radicals in denominator. We also learn that when adding or subtraction, we can treat a radical the same way we treat a variable.

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 8 - The Pythagorean Theorem
Description: We learn to use the Pythagorean Theorem in this lesson. "The square of the Hypotenuse equals the sum of the squares of the other two sides."

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 10 - Distance and Midpoint Formulas
Description: In this lesson we learn to calculate the length of a line segment, and the midpoint of a line segment.

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 11 - Inverse Variation
Description: Inverse Variation is the topic in this lesson. We graph Inverse Variations, and learn about hyperbolas and their branches, asymptotes, and the constant of variation.

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 12 - Graphing Rational Functions
Description: In this lesson we learn how to graph Rational Functions. We learn how to use the Vertical and Horizontal Asymptotes to draw the hyperbolas that represent variations from the Parent Rational Function.

Title: Quarter 4 Lesson 14 - Simplifying Rational Expressions
Description: We learn what a rational expression is, and how to simplify it. We learn to identify a rational expression's excluded values.

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 18 - Mathematical Operations with Rational Expressions
Description: Well, there's nothing new here. Simple stuff. We're just going to apply the rules and procedures we learned in grade school. We're going to see that adding, subtracting, multiplying and dividing algebraic rational expressions is just like math operations with numerical fractions.

Title: Quarter 4, Lesson 16 - Solving Rational Equations
Description: In this lesson we learn to solve rational equations using Cross Products, and by multiplying each term by the Lowest Common Denominator (LCD).

Title: Qtr 4, Lesson 8: Gross Pay, Payroll Deductions, Net Pay
Description: This lesson explains Gross and Net Pay, and describes typical payroll deductions. The importance of a personal budget is discussed.

Title: Qtr 4, Lesson 7: Credit Cards
Description: Learn how credit cards work, and how your credit score can save or cost you money each month.

Title: Qtr 4, Lesson 6: Checking Accounts
Description: We learn about checks, check registries and debit cards in this lesson.

Title: Qtr 4, Lesson 5: Installment Loans
Description: Learn about Installment Loans: what they are; why they are important to you; and how they work.

Title: Qtr 4, Lesson 3: Formula for Compound Interest
Description: This lesson discusses how to calculate account balances in the future when interest is compounded.

Title: Qtr 4, Lesson 2: Simple and Compound Interest
Description: This is the first in a series of lessons teaching financial literacy principals for teenagers. This lesson teaches how to calculate Interest and Balance.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 4: Domain and Range of a Function - 8th Grade Math
Description: We learn about functions and their domain and range.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 9: Solving Inequalities
Description: In this lesson we learn about linear inequalities, how to graph them, and how to solve them using addition, subtraction, multiplication and division.

Title: Qtr 1, Lesson 10: Ratios and Rates
Description: This is a video lesson explaining ratios, rates and unit rates, with problems to test what you've learned. The video contains several example problems that are worked through. This would be good to use at an independent computer station during math rotations. There is also a link for printed out problems.

Title: Qtr 1, Lesson 1: Integers and Absolute Value
Description: A middle school math lesson to help understand Integers and Absolute Value

Title: Qtr 1, Lesson 2: Adding and Subtracting Integers
Description: A video lesson teaching how to add and subtract with integers. An emphasis on negative numbers.

Title: Qtr 1, Lesson 3: Multiply and Divide Integers
Description: A lesson on multiplying and dividing positive and negative integers. When is the product of 2 numbers negative?

Title: Qtr 1, Lesson 4: Coordinate Plane
Description: A math lesson describing the Coordinate Plane and its uses.

Title: Qtr 1, Lesson 12: Writing and Solving Proportions
Description: This lesson explains what a proportion is, and shows how to use proportions to solve practical problems. We learn to write a proportional relationship.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 9: Analyzing Data
Description: This is a lesson describing how data can be analyzed using mean, median, mode and range. It also covers how to bar graph or scatter plot the data, or do interval analysis. It shows which measure of central tendency fits the data best.

Title: Qtr 2, Lesson 4: Finding Percent of a Number
Description: In this lesson we learn how to calculate percent of a number: what is 8% of 163? We work hard at the mental math tricks that allow us to calculate percent of a number without use of a calculator.

Title: Qtr 3, Lesson 3: Perimeter and Area of Composite Figures
Description: In this lesson we work on "deconstructing" composite figures so we can determine their perimeter and area.

Title: Algebra Commutative and Associative Properties
Description: In this lesson we learn about the Commutative and the Associative Properties of Addition and Multiplication.

Title: Moore's Law and The Secret World Of Ones And Zeroes
Description: SciShow explains how SciShow exists -- and everything else that's ever been made or used on a computer -- by exploring how transistors work together in circuits to make all computing possible. Like all kinds of science, it has its limitations, but also awesome possibilities.

Title: Converting Improper Fractions to Mixed Numbers
Description: Instructor uses a white board to demonstrate how to convert improper fractions to mixed numbers. Students learn that a proper fraction is a fraction whose numerator is less than or equal to its denominator. For example, 3/7, 16/18, and 4/4 are proper fractions. And an improper fraction is a fraction ...Show More

Title: Easy Ways to Learn Fractions
Description: In math, fractions can be thought of as proportions of a shape. In this clip discover easy ways to learn fraction from a mathematics teacher. The math teacher shows examples on a whiteboard of shapes representing the fractions.

Title: Learning Fractions
Description: This short video is from Jimmy Chang, who has a master's degree in math and has been a math teacher at St. Pete College for more than ten years. For upper elementary grades. In this video Jimmy explains what fractions are and what their purpose is.

Title: Visual Learning Bridge: Understanding 1 as a Fraction
Description: This interactive video introduces students to the number 1 as a fraction. Students will easily understand the colorful and concrete visuals. Words appear on bottom of screen as speaker talks. This is a great resource to use as an introduction and/or to review in the elementary classroom.

Title: Fractions Basics, Proper, Improper, and Mixed Song – Learn Fractions
Description: Learn the basics of fractions through music!

Title: Introduction to Fractions Song
Description: This is a song that uses a pie to introduce fractions. The video includes: proper, improper, and mixed fractions. It's a fun video to watch and explains fractions in easy terms. It also includes imagery and text of key terms

Title: Pentagon Circus
Description: A computer-generated animation, with lively musical accompaniment. It whimsically explores the geometric relationship between two regular polyhedrons, a cube and a dodecahedron.

Title: Recognizing Polygons
Description: Tim Bedley, veteran teacher, gives a mini lesson to remind students how to recognize a polygon. He uses an interactive board to illustrate how to recognize polygons. This is a great resource to introduce and/or to review polygons in the elementary classroom.

Title: Math: Rotating Designs: Polygons
Description: Math: Rotating Designs: Polygons! Teacher/School Erika Meadows American Falls School District

Title: How to Make a Circle Graph
Description: Watch this video on how to determine percentages and construct a circle graph using a protractor. The sound quality could be better.

Title: Hyperbolic Geometry Song
Description: Song describing what hyperbolic geometry is. The singing is just adequate and somewhat difficult to understand.

Title: Absolute Value and Evaluating Numbers
Description: In this video, the instructor defines absolute value and shows a variety of examples to practice the concept. Examples range from very simple to more complex.

Title: Evaluating Expressions Involving Absolute Value
Description: This video explains how to evaluate expressions involving absolute value. The examples include a few very basic problems involving simplifications with absolute value.

Title: Absolute Value & The Opposite of a Number
Description: The first thing that is discussed in this video is the definition of absolute value. Absolute value actually represents distance and is always positive, the symbol of an absolute value is the two bars around the value. Distances are always positive that is why absolute values are always positive. They ...Show More

Title: How to Solve Direct Proportions
Description: This video is geared for eighth-grade Algebra students. This video illustrates how to solve direct proportions. Examples and rules are presented on a white board. For additional exercises and worksheets follow the link provided at the end of the video.

Title: Solve Direct Proportion Problems Using the Unitary Method
Description: In this video you can find constant proportionality and use it to form an equation to solve problems. Key words relating to direct proportion are discussed. Some examples of problems are looked at and solved in the video. Practice question and answers are presented at the end of the video.

Title: Find Missing Term in a Proportion
Description: This is a video presentation in direct proportion. The objective of the video is to find the missing term expressed as x in a proportion. An example is used with the number of dogs.

Title: Direct Proportion Ice Cream Drama
Description: This is a student made ice cream drama set in the early part of the 20th century. A relationship is established in the drama about the ice cream and the weather to teach the concept of direct proportion. As the temperature increases the man buys more ice cream. An example of this direct proportion is ...Show More

Title: Steps For Solving 3 Proportion Examples
Description: In this video 3 examples are solved on proportions. a review is made of of what a proportion is before the problems are solved on a white board. A proportion are two ratios that are equal to each other.

Title: Direct Variation Word Problem
Description: This video is a lesson on direct variation or direct proportion. The instructor reads a sample word problem that involves direct variation and shows the steps necessary to solve the problem. She explains the formula for direct variation, then plugs in the numbers from the problem to find the constant ...Show More

Title: Solving Indirect Proportion Math Problems
Description: Indirect proportion problems sound technical, but it helps to think of the word "indirect" as "inverse." In this video learn why an inverse has the unknown, X, in the denominator with help from a math teacher.

Title: Inverse Variation
Description: This lesson shows an instructor explaining how to solve an inverse variation problem. The lesson assumes some knowledge of how to complete this type of problem.

Title: Solving Indirect Proportion Math Problems
Description: In math, an indirect proportion is when an increase in one quantity results in a decrease in another quantity. Solve indirect proportion math problems with tips from a math teacher in this video.

Title: Median of a Trapezoid
Description: In this video students learn the definitions of a trapezoid, an isosceles trapezoid, and the median of a trapezoid. Students also learn the following theorems related to trapezoids. The base angles of an isosceles trapezoid are congruent. The median of a trapezoid is (a) parallel to the bases and (b) ...Show More

Title: Parallelogram and Trapezoid Comparison
Description: This video makes comparisons of the characteristics of trapezoids and parallelograms. Addressing the question as to whether a parallelogram is also a trapezoid. The answer will depend on your definition of trapezoid. If a trapezoid has exactly one pair of parallel lines, then parallelogram doesn't fit ...Show More

Title: Finding the Height of a Trapezoid
Description: In math, finding the height of a trapezoid can be done by first finding the area and working backwards. Find the height of a trapezoid with tips from a math teacher in this video.

Title: FIND THE MISTAKE 1
Description: In this video, we will solve a mathematic question by making common mistakes that are made by students and the student has one week to find those mistakes and correct the question. After one week we will show where the mistake and we will do another problem. Learn From Mistake

Title: FIND THE MISTAKE 3
Description: In this video, we will solve a mathematic question by making common mistakes that are made by students and the student has one week to find those mistakes and correct the question. After one week we will show where the mistake and we will do another problem. Duration:9:37

Title: FIND THE MISTAKE 6
Description: In this video, we will solve a mathematic question by making common mistakes that are made by students and the student has one week to find those mistakes and correct the question. After one week we will show where the mistake and we will do another problem. Duration:4:09

Title: Indiana Basketball Team Movie Skit About Substitution In Algebra
Description: This is an entertaining movie using model figures of the Indiana Basketball Team. They solve a substitution math problem in the clip when they have to decide which team members to substitute. University. There is no narration in this video. The figures talk using text bubbles.

Title: How to Solve Equations by Substitution
Description: In order to solve math substitution equations, there needs to be an equation that gives one variable in terms of the other. Solve equations by substitution with tips from a math teacher in this video.

Title: Multiplying Decimals
Description: Students learn to multiply decimals in the same way that one would multiply whole numbers (vertically). However, at the end of the problem, students must determine where the decimal goes in the answer by counting the total number of digits to the right of the decimal point in the original numbers, then ...Show More

Title: Converting Fractions to Percents
Description: Instructor uses a white board to demonstrate how to convert fractions to percents. Proportions are used to find the fraction that is equivalent to the given fraction and whose denominator is 100. The definition of a percent is explained.

Title: Equivalent Fractions
Description: A fraction is a number that can represent a part of a whole. This video shows students different examples of equivalent fractions. Equivalent fractions are equal to one another. An animated story about gold bars is shown. This is a great resource to introduce and/or review fractions in the classroom.

Title: Equivalent Fractions
Description: Students learn that two fractions are equivalent if the fractions are the same when they are written in lowest terms. For example, 4/7 and 8/14 are equivalent fractions, because they are both equal to 4/7 when written in lowest terms. Students also learn to find fractions that are equivalent to a given ...Show More

Title: Division Array Model for Fractions
Description: The instructor uses paper, pen, and colored markers to show how to invert and multiply as one algorithm for division of fractions. Introduces mixed numbers. Clear teaching and models. Sound and camera work are average.

Title: Dividing Fractions
Description: This is a lesson on how to divide fractions.The instructor uses a white board. He uses a great expression called 'flip and dip."

Title: Dividing With Mixed Numbers
Description: This is a lesson on how to divide fractions with mixed numbers.The instructor uses a white board and goes step-by-step.

Title: Dividing Mixed Numbers
Description: The instructor uses an electronic chalkboard to demonstrate how to divide mixed numbers. One example is modeled using a step-by-step approach.

Title: Division with Fractions
Description: This video indicates it is for pre-algebra, however this video would be good for anyone who is reviewing or learning division of fractions. In the video division of fractions starts with dividing a whole number by a fraction. The instructer uses a number line to show this concept, then does the problem, ...Show More

Title: Converting Mixed Numbers to Improper Fractions
Description: This video is from The Math Party National Standards Program and features a rap song to help students remember how to convert mixed numbers to improper fractions.

Title: Converting Improper Fraction to Mixed Number
Description: Instructor uses a white board to demonstrate how to change an improper fraction to a mixed number. This video shows the student step by step how to convert, this is a great beginning video for students. Video is good quality and good for all students as a review or initial learning of the topic.

Title: Learn The Basics to Subtracting Fractions
Description: John Zimmerman from www.tabletclass.com explains how to subtract fractions. The instructor uses computer software to illustrate his points and feels that math students in middle school and basic math should find the lesson helpful. The two examples used in this video are 3/5-1/5 and 4 1/2- 2 2/3.

Title: Subtracting Fractions From a Whole Number
Description: In this short video, students can learn how to subtract fractions from a whole number. The instructor uses computer software to demonstrate. Only one example is used in this video: 3-1/16.

Title: Subtracting Fractions with Like Denominators
Description: This is a teaching video to demonstrate how to subtract fractions with like denominators. Contains examples and practice problems.

Title: Adding Fractions
Description: This short lesson shows a teacher walking students through a addition problem with fractions. It includes how to convert an improper fraction to a mixed number. The teacher works the problem as it is explained in the video.

Title: Adding Fractions
Description: In this video students learn to add or subtract fractions using the least common denominator, which is the least common multiple for the denominators of the fractions. Once the fractions are given a common denominator by multiplying the numerator and denominator of each fraction by the appropriate number, ...Show More

Title: unFOILed: Episode 1 -- Adding Fractions
Description: Join Professor McComb, Adam, Diffy, Delta, Polly, Denom & Ator as they travel to Parallel-a-Land to learn about adding fractions. Featuring special guest star N.O.I.D. (Number One in Disguise).

Title: Adding and Subtracting Fractions / Mixed Numbers: Example 4
Description: Adding and Subtracting Fractions / Mixed Numbers: Example 4. Here we look at another subtraction problem involving fractions.

Description: Adding and Subtracting Fractions / Mixed Numbers: Example 3. In this video, the instructor shows how to add / subtract fractions that have different denominators at the beginning.

Title: Adding and Subtracting Fractions / Mixed Numbers: Example 1
Description: N/A

Title: Finding Common Denominator
Description: This selection teaches three ways to find a common denominator: see if the smaller denominator goes into the larger one, multiply the two denominators, or find the least common multiple. An example of each method is worked on an interactive white board.

Title: Introduction to Fractions, Part 4
Description: In this video they are teaching the lowest common denominator. They start with a fraction problem with all different denominators, so they need to find the lowest common denominator. Some examples are done. Video is good quality and good for all students as review or initial learning of the concept.

Title: Regular and Irregular Geometric Shapes
Description: Teacher demonstrates regular and irregular geometric shapes at the white board. Understand the types of geometric shapes with tips from a mathematics teacher. Recommends trying to break complex shapes into simple shapes.

Title: Geometric Shapes
Description: This video clip shows a hand drawn geometric shape as the definition scrolls over the shape. Definitions are wordy. Nice musical background. Student created geometry project.

Description: The instructor uses an electronic sketchpad to explain and demonstrates the fundamental concepts (undefined terms) of geometry: point, line, plane.

Description: A five minute review with background music to definitions and descriptions of points, lines, and planes. Collinear and noncollinear points are explained as well as coplanar and non coplanar points.

Description: This short powerpoint presentation on Point, Lines, and Planes will surely help the students taking up Geometry class in high school or college to really understand the basic of Geometry. Description: This one-minute video is from The Math Party National Standards Program and features a catchy tune to help students remember lines, rays, line segments, and planes.

Title: Proving Lines are Parallel
Description: If two lines are cut by a transversal and corresponding angles are congruent, then the lines are parallel. If two lines are cut by a transversal and alternate interior angles are congruent, then the lines are parallel. If two lines are cut by a transversal and same-side interior angles are supplementary, ...Show More

Title: Definition of Parallel Lines
Description: Students learn the definitions of parallel lines, skew lines, parallel planes, and transversals, and are asked to identify these types of lines/planes in given figures. Students are also asked to identify alternate interior angles, same-side interior angles, and corresponding angles. Always, sometimes, ...Show More

Title: Line Segments
Description: In this very brief video, students learn the definitions of a point, a line, a segment, and a ray in this video. Instructor uses a whiteboard.

Title: Length of a Line Segment
Description: This lesson uses two examples to demonstrate how to use the length of a line segment formula. This is one of a series of math video lessons created for a grade 10 Academic math course in the province of Ontario, Canada. The instructor uses computer software for his demonstration.

Title: Graphing Ordered Pairs
Description: This short video show the basics of graphing ordered pairs. The presenter uses a coordinate grid interactive board to show how to plot an ordered pair.

Title: The Coordinate Plane
Description: This video covers the basics of coordinates planes such as: the /y/ and /x/ axes, quadrants, origin, and ordered pairs. This is a good introduction.

Description: This video uses populations of the U.S. from 1910-2010 as data to be plotted on a coordinate plane. NOTE: this is a very casual lesson with a conversational tone as opposed to a professional presentation.

Title: Parallel and Perpendicular Lines Song – Geometry – Learning Upgrade

Description: Lesson on rhombuses, parallelograms, and traezoids. This lesson is an introduction to these figures that come up in geometry. Larry explains figures on a white board. More lessons at: http://www.MathWithLarry.com

Title: Singapore Math, Grade 5 / Primary 5: Geometry - Drawing parallelogram using instruments
Description: Learn how to draw a parallelogram in a few easy steps in ten minutes.

Title: SEGMENTS AND RAYS
Description: This short powerpoint presentation is designed to help the high school students really appreciate the beauty of mathematics and its real life application.

Description: This lesson will teach you how to solve a quadratic equation using Quadratic Formula and discuss the different type of solutions of a quadratic equation. Duration: 7:21

Description: Math instructor demonstrates on white board how to find the slope of a line from a table. Uses colored markers for clarification.

Title: How to Calculate the Slope of a Line
Description: Calculating the slope of a line will result in either a positive number, a negative number, zero or an undefined value, and the slope is always represented with the letter M. The instructor uses a document camera to model how to find the slope of a line using the formula for slope.

Title: How to Calculate Slope
Description: This is a lesson on explaining that the slope of a line measures how steep a line is. It is calculated by comparing two points along the line. A professional math tutor calculates the slope of a line on a whiteboard.

Title: Finding the Slope Given a Line
Description: The instructor uses an electronic chalkboard to demonstrate how to find the slope of a linear equation when given the line of that equation. One example is modeled showing how to choose two points and determine the rise over the run.

Description: The instructor uses the electronic chalkboard to demonstrate how to determine the slope of a line when given two points that are on that line. Using the graph is modeled first followed by a step by step approach using the formula for slope.

Title: Finding the Slope of a Line When Given a Graph
Description: The instructor uses an electronic chalkboard to demonstrate how to find the slope of a line when given its graph. A definition of slope is given and one example is modeled using a step by step approach to determine the slope of the given line.

Title: Solving Absolute Value Equations
Description: In math, absolute value equations are best solved by isolating the absolute value portion from the rest of the equation. Title: Solving Multi-Step Equations with Variables on Both Sides
Description: The instructor uses an electronic chalkboard to demonstrate how to solve a multi-step equation with variables on both side of the equation. One example is modeled using a step by step approach to solve for x.

Description: In math, the absolute value of a number is its distance from zero. Solve absolute value equations with tips from a math teacher in this video on solving math problems.

Description: How to solve absolute value equations classroom notes example. This video shows a piece of paper with the equation being worked out. The instructor's narration is nice and clear.

Title: Graphing Ordered Pairs

Title: Finding the Distance Between Two Points
Description: The instructor uses an electronic chalkboard to demonstrate how to find the distance between two points on the coordinate plane. One example is modeled using the distance formula.

Description: The instructor uses a protractor, pen, and paper to demonstrate how to use a protractor to measure angles.

Description: In this video, which was originally on TeacherTube, students will learn how to use and read a protractor. Instructor gives a brief review of angles. She uses computer software for the demonstration.

Title: Solving Special Right Triangles
Description: When solving special right triangles, remember that a 30-60-90 triangle has a hypotenuse twice as long as one of the sides, and a 45-45-90 triangle has two equal sides. Memorize rules that relate to special right triangles with instructions from a math teacher.

Description: Holes are missing points in the graph of a rational equation. A hole in a graph of a rational equation will occur when a value of x causes both the numerator and denominator to equal zero. An example is shown on an interactive white board.

Title: Math Snacks--Overruled! Proportions and Equivalent Ratios
Description: Two besotted rulers must embrace proportional units in order to complete a bridge to unite their lands. It takes mathematical reasoning to deduce the problem, and solution, when engineers from Queentopia and Kingopolis try to build a bridge that meets in the middle of the river. This is a great resource ...Show More

Title: Teach Me How To Factor Rap Song
Description: (Parody of Teach Me How To Dougie by Cali Swag District) A teacher made video and song teaching the high school math students how to factor. This is a great resource to help teach mastery of these important skills.

Title: Common Factoring Polynomials and Grouping -Pre-Algebra Help
Description: This three minute video explains this process using a narrator and a white board. First, you must find the Factors for example 4(x+y)=4x+4y. In that equation 4 X and Y are the factors. An error is noted and corrected on the video. The video moves fairly rapidly and so the teacher may wish to stop it ...Show More

Title: Prime Numbers and Prime Factorization
Description: This video explains factors: what they are and how to find them and then explains what a prime number is and how to find the prime factorization of composite numbers. Title: Algebra Review 4.3 - Factoring

Title: Simplifying Exponents (Multiplication and Division)
Description: Ms. Rebecca Newburn instructs students about how to properly address exponents when multiplying and dividing monomials. Ms. Newman also reminds viewers which errors to avoid and explains why the answers she gets are correct. Visual quality not in high definition, but sufficient enough to see examples.

Title: Multiplying With Exponents
Description: This animated selection defines the terms base and exponent. Students are shown how to solve a multiplication problem containing an exponent. This slide show could serve as an introduction or review.

Title: The Exponent Zero
Description: Any base number raised to the power zero results in the number one. This video shows several examples using number manipulatives accompanied by narration.

Title: Super Base (WSHS Math Rap Song - Exponents)
Description: Westerville South High School, Westerville, Ohio (Parody of Super Bass by Nicki Minaj). This song is about exponents. How to figure out the number when raised to a certain exponent, how to figure out a number when raised to a negative number, and the rules for multiplying, dividing, and raising to a ...Show More

Title: How Folding Paper Can Get You to the Moon
Description: Can folding a piece of paper 45 times get you to the moon? By seeing what happens when folding just one piece of paper, we see the unbelievable potential of exponential growth. This lesson will leave you wanting to grab a piece of paper to see how many times you can fold it! Lesson by Adrian Paenza, ...Show More

Title: Roots and Unit Fraction Exponents
Description: Exponents can not only be integers. They can also be fractions. Using the rules of exponents, we can see why a number raised to the power "one over n" is equivalent to the nth root of that number.

Title: Solving a Simple Quadratic Equation
Description: In this video, the instructor shows how to solve a simple quadratic equation without a linear term. He uses paper and pen to model examples. This is an amateur production (a little blurry), but understandable.

Title: Quadratic Formula Application for Highway Design – Defining the Shape of a Vertical Curve
Description: The instructor introduces the use of the quadratic formula which governs the shape of vertical curves in roadway design. This application provides a practical use of the quadratic formula that defines most vertical curves on roadways. This application can be replicated by a teacher with local information ...Show More

Title: Algebra 1 - Graphing Linear Equations Using Tables and Intercepts
Description: In this video clip we graph linear equations using tables. We also graph equations by determining the x - and y - Intercepts and talk about interpreting the graph. The video also provides a section of questions for the viewers after each lesson.

Title: Algebra 1 - Coordinate Plane, Introduction to Graphing Linear Equations
Description: In this video clip, the lesson reviews the coordinate planes and prepares the viewers to start graphing equations. The video provides clear examples with questions for viewers to answer after each lesson.

Title: Multiplying Two Small Matrices
Description: In this video, an instructor explains the procedure for multiplying two small matrices. He also provides an example to show when two matrices cannot be multiplied. The problems are shown on a white board.

Title: Matrices Lesson 3 Multiplication
Description: This lesson will teach you how to multiply matrices in a very simple way.

Title: Finding The Midsegment of a Triangle
Description: In this vdeo students learn the following theorems related to parallel lines. If 3 parallel lines form congruent segments along one transversal, then they form congruent segments along every transversal. If a line intersects the midpoint of one side a triangle and is parallel to another side of the triangle, ...Show More

Title: Definition of Altitude of a Triangle
Description: Students learn the definitions of a median of a triangle, an altitude of a triangle, and a perpendicular bisector. Students are then asked to identify or draw medians, altitudes, and perpendicular bisectors in given triangles.

Title: Introduction to Triangles With Mathemachicken Teacher
Description: In this lesson in the classroom a teacher dressed as a MathemaCHICKEN "gobbles" through each type of triangle. Students sing a song about triangles and define isosceles, scalene, right, equilateral,obtuse, and acute triangles. An entertaining and educational introduction to triangles. To finish the lesson ...Show More

Title: Classifying Triangles
Description: This lesson defines and shows examples of various types of triangles: scalene, isosceles, equilateral, acute, obtuse, and right.

Title: Overlapping Triangles
Description: The instructor uses a smartboard to demonstrate what overlapping triangles are and their properties. The room is dark, hence the video is a little dark. The instructor teaches grade 9 Geometry at Martin Luther High School in Maspeth, NY.

Title: The Pythagorean Theorem
Description: Students learn the Pythagorean Theorem, which states that the sum of the squares of the lengths of the legs of a right triangle is equal to the square of the length of the hypotenuse, or a^2 + b^2 = c^2. Students are then asked to find missing side lengths of right triangles using the Pythagorean Theorem.

Title: Pythagorean Theorem in 60 Seconds
Description: The instructor uses a white board to demonstrate how to use the Pythagorean Theorem to find missing sides of a right triangle. One example is modeled using a step by step approach to plugging known values in to the formula for Pythagorean Theorem.

Title: What Is the Pythagorean Theorem and How Do You Use it?
Description: The Pythagorean theorem is a formula used to solve side lengths of a right triangle, and it is expressed as A squared plus B squared equals C squared. The instructor uses a document camera to model what the Pythagorean Theorem is and how to use it.

Title: Pythagorean Theorem - Yay Math
Description: Using the Pythagorean Theorem to solve for the sides of a triangle and to prove the triangle is right angled. White board in a class setting, some interaction, engaging, several examples of increasing complexity. The discussion is clear and understandable.

Title: Multiplication Rule (Probability "and")
Description: The instructor, while using computer software, discusses the multiplication rule in probability. The instructor talks a little fast, so this video will be more helpful if a classroom teacher supplements this information with prior discussion.

Title: Circles Song – Learn Geometry – Learning Upgrade
Description: Hi Def version of the popular Circles song from the Math Upgrade online courses by Learning Upgrade. Teaches radius, diameter, circumference, pi.

Title: Circles, Cylinders, and Spheres
Description: The video starts with a circle and finding its circumference, what the circumference is, what radius is and then using the formula for finding the circumference. Then they move onto area of a circle. Cylinders are addressed next, they discuss the volume of a cylinder, discuss the meaning of each of the ...Show More

Description: Learn circumference, radius, pi and more through music! Video is good quality and good for all students as review ...Show More

Title: 'Days in the Months' Song
Description: This song teaches the number of days in each month. Students will learn which months have 30 days and 31 days and Leap Year. This is a great resource to help students important this important concept.

Title: Exploring Our Number System
Description: Simple ideas, like adding together two odds to make an even, can lead to fascinating insights with important real world applications.We offer you some simple starting points exploring factors and multiples, remainders and number bases, the foundations of the field mathematicians call Number Theory.

Title: Factors and Multiples
Description: Factors and multiples are the building blocks of Number Theory. Try these problems and games and get to grips with the underlying structure of our number system.

Title: Seeing is Believing
Description: Some problems become much clearer when you find a good image to represent them, and some mathematical results can be proved beautifully with just a simple diagram. We hope you will find plenty to inspire you here to draw your own diagrams as well as using our images to discover relationships and make ...Show More

Title: Centred Shapes
Description: Centred Shapes are made by building up a pattern of dots in a certain shape. Explore how centred shapes can fit together, and see how many patterns you can find!

Title: Move it to prove it
Description: Sometimes, all you need to do to prove a mathematical result is look at it in the right way. Explore these tasks to see how moving shapes can help you to prove results.

Title: Always a Multiple?

Title: Dodecagon dissection
Description: Grab a ruler, paper and scissors, construct a dodecagon, and cut it up. Can you reassemble it in a way to help you find its area?

Title: Exploring Number Shapes
Description: Find out about centred shapes here! You can watch a short video that shows, in pictures, how centred triangles are made up of a triangular number and a square number. Then, why not explore some of these suggested number relationships yourself?
